frame.name: Manipulation
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an <fen>Entity</fen> by an <fen>Agent</fen>. Generally, this implies that the <fen>Entity</fen> is not deeply or permanently physically affected, nor is it overall moved from one place to another.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Ian</fex> <t>squeezed</t> <fex name="Entity">Mara's hand</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex>
A number of lexemes listed in this frame also occur in the Cause_motion frame (for example, <ment>push, yank</ment>). Only the non-motion uses of these words belong in this frame, e.g., combinations such as <ment>push at, push on, yank at</ment>. </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates an object. <fen>Agent</fen> typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects. <fen>Agent</fen> is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs:
<ex><fex name="Agent">A robot arm</fex> <t>grasps</t> the box on the conveyor belt and seals it.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs:
<ex><t>Squeeze</t> <fex name="Entity">the ball</fex> as many times as you can.</ex> <ex>Pat <t>squeezed</t> <fex name="Entity">Jo's hand</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locus
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s manipulation of an <fen>Entity</fen> may be further specified as being localized to some part of the <fen>Entity</fen>, a <fen>Locus</fen>. The <fen>Locus</fen> is usually expressed as a PP Complement. <ex>Pat <t>squeezed</t> Jo <fex name="Locus">by the hand</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Bodypart_of_agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body being used to manipulate the <fen>Entity</fen> may also be expressed. While the default is for an <fen>Agent</fen> to use his/her hands, other body parts may be specified. This frame element usually occurs as a PP-complement. <ex>Kim <t>grasped</t> the needle <fex name="Bodypart_of_agent">between finger and thumb</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of the manipulation.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>When the manipulation takes place <ex>I <t>seized</t> the letter <fex name="Time">before he did</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s purpose in performing the manipulation. <ex>The President <t>grabbed</t> <t>hold</t> of the handle of the helicopter <fex name="Purp">to avoid being blown away</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that interacts with the <fen>Entity</fen> to accomplish the action indicated by the target.
<ex>Smithers <t>nudged</t> the insect <fex name="Instrument">with a paper towel</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action by the <fen>Agent</fen> to accomplish the desired manipulation.
<ex>Martin <t>clutched</t> it <fex name="Means">by pulling a rope attached to a pully which tightened the belt to the PVC</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The spatial setting in which the manipulation takes place.
<ex><fex name="Place">In the hallway</fex> he managed to <t>grab</t>the monarch by the ankles</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a depictive phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Bodypart_of_agent</fen> that holds throughout the action.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs leading to the manipulation.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: strelen.v
lexUnit.definition: zachtjes met je handen over iets of iemand heen gaan om hem, haar of het een goed gevoel te geven (ook figuurlijk)

lexUnit.name: aaien.v
lexUnit.definition: zacht met de hand ergens overheen strijken om een aangenaam gevoel op te wekken of als uiting van tederheid

lexUnit.name: vrijen.v
lexUnit.definition: je liefde uiten door lichamelijk contact, bijv. door te zoenen of te strelen, of (soms ook) door geslachtsgemeenschap
